japanese: ……これは難問だなぁ。
translation: ...This is a hard problem.

japanese:
今まで勉強してきたことを思い出せ。
基礎はできている、あとは応用だ！
translation:
Time to recall all the stuff you've studied.
You have the basics, now to apply them!

japanese: わかった、頑張ってみるよ。
translation: Okay, I'll give it a shot.

japanese:
（ここを乗り越えられたら
　もっと難易度の高い問題も解けるようになる！
　頑張れ一花！）
translation:
(If you can overcome this,
 you'll be able to solve even more difficult problems!
 Do your best, Ichika!)

japanese:
えっと……これを代入して……。
それから……えーっと……。
translation:
Um...substitute this here...
Then...ummm...

japanese: あの、フータロー君？
translation: Um, Futaro-kun?

japanese: なんだ？
translation: What?

japanese:
すっごく怖い顔で
プレッシャーかけてくるの、やめてくれるかな？
問題に集中できないよ。
translation:
You're putting so much pressure on me
with such a scary face, will you stop?
I can't concentrate on the problem.

japanese: あっ！　すまん！
translation: Ah! Sorry!

japanese: 見張ってなくてもサボったりしないよ。
translation:
Even if you're not watching over me,
I won't skip anything.

japanese: （サボるなんて思ってないが……）
translation: (I didn't think you would skip anything...)

japanese: これはこうだから……最後に……。
translation: This is how this goes...so finally...

japanese: できたーー！
translation: I did it...!

japanese: あ、待って！
translation: Ah, wait!

japanese:
うん……うん……。
よし、計算ミスしてないしホントにこれで終わり！
translation:
Okay...okay...
great, I haven't made any calculation mistakes,
so I'm finished!

japanese:
よくやったな、一花。
採点するから休んでていいぞ。
translation:
Well done, Ichika.
I'll grade it, so take a breather.

japanese:
ふう……。
途中で詰まったときは諦めそうになったけど――
translation:
Whew...
I almost gave up when I got stuck in the middle, but%p-2;――

japanese:
君の怖い顔見たら、習ったことが
ぱっと頭に浮かんできて、なんとかなったよ。
translation:
When I saw your scary face,
I remembered what I had learned,
and I managed to solve it.

japanese: なあ、俺はそんなに怖い顔してるのか？
translation: Hey, was I really making such a scary face?

japanese:
自覚ないんだ。
気をつけなよー？
translation:
You're not very self-aware.
So, be careful, okay?

japanese: （と言われてもな……）
translation: (Even if you say that...)

japanese:
問題が解けて、やった！　っていう気持ちが
一番強いのって数学なのかも。
translation:
I think solving a math problem gives me the
most sense of achievement.

japanese:
フータロー君は？
問題が解けたらそういう気持ちになる？
translation:
What about you, Futaro-kun?
Do you feel that way if you solve a problem?

japanese:
確かに、難問を征服したときに
満足感を得ることはあるぞ。
translation:
I can certainly feel satisfied
when I conquer a difficult problem.

japanese:
征服って。
なんか私とレベルが違うけど……
私もいつかそういう満足を感じられるのかな？
translation:
Conquer, you say.
I feel that's kinda on a different level than me...
Could I feel that kind of satisfaction someday?
